page.title: 13SUNDERLAND AIRPORT
page.content: In June 1984, Sunderland Airport closed. The airfield was handed over to Nissan for the development of its car plant. So ended sixty years of Sunderland's association with flying. The airfield appeared during the 1914-18 war, but was not really developed until 1930 when it became an R.A.F.Auxiliary Aerodrome, housing 607 City of Durham Squadron. The outbreak of World War Two heralded the most important period in its history. After its first 'kill' when three Gladiators shot down a Dornier Flying Boat, in December 1939, it served with distinction throughout the Battle of Britain, protecting Sunderland in the famous daylight raid of August 15th 1949. In 1963 the Corporation took it over and it became a Civil Airport until its closure last year.
